guide.title: User Guide
guide.subtitle: Learn how to effectively use the IT Project Management Expert System

createProject.title: How to Create a New Project
createProject.intro: To get expert recommendations, you need to create a project and fill in its parameters.
createProject.step1: In the top menu, click the purple ＋ button — it's always the first item in the navigation.
createProject.step2: Enter the project name, description, and all parameters: team size, budget, complexity, and more.
createProject.step3: Click 'Save & Analyze' — the system will automatically run the expert analysis.
createProject.screenshotCaption: Project creation form with all parameters

dataUsed.title: What Data Is Used for Analysis
dataUsed.intro: The system considers 10 key parameters of your project. Each parameter has its own weight in the final analysis.
dataUsed.weights: The highest weights go to complexity (15%), project type (12%), and risk level (12%). Team size and experience also significantly influence the result.

teamSize.name: Team Size
teamSize.desc: Number of people on the project (weight 10%)

howAnalysis.title: How Analysis Works
howAnalysis.intro: The system uses three inference mechanisms that work in parallel and complement each other.

ruleBased.title: Rule-Based Inference
ruleBased.desc: A set of IF-THEN rules checks your project parameters and awards points to strategies that match the conditions. For example: if requirements are volatile and team is experienced → recommend Scrum.

caseBased.title: Case-Based Reasoning (CBR)
caseBased.desc: The system finds similar projects in the knowledge base by comparing all 10 parameters. Strategies from successful similar projects receive bonus points.

scenario.title: Scenario Analysis
scenario.desc: For each strategy, 3 scenarios are modeled: optimistic, realistic, and pessimistic — with estimates of budget impact, timeline, and success probability.

howAnalysis.screenshotCaption: Project parameters and key decision factors

responseFormed.title: How the Response Is Formed
responseFormed.intro: The final score for each strategy is a weighted combination of scores from two main mechanisms.
responseFormed.step1: Production rules check conditions and award points. The result is normalized to 50 points.
responseFormed.step2: CBR finds similar projects and evaluates their strategies' success. A bonus is added for successful outcomes.
responseFormed.step3: If a strategy was successful in similar projects, it receives an additional bonus.
responseFormed.step4: Strategies are sorted by total score. The best one gets the 'Best Match' label.
responseFormed.accuracyGood: The more accurately parameters are filled — the better the recommendation
responseFormed.accuracyKB: The more projects in the knowledge base — the more accurate CBR analysis
responseFormed.accuracyWarn: The evaluation is advisory and does not replace professional manager experience
responseFormed.screenshotCaption: Recommended strategy with match percentage and scenario analysis

formulaDesc.sma: Simple Moving Average smooths the series by averaging the last k values
formulaDesc.ema: Exponential Smoothing gives more weight to recent observations
formulaDesc.holt: Holt's method accounts for both level and trend in the time series

insights.title: PM Insights
insights.highOverrun: High risk of budget overrun. Cost review recommended.
insights.improvingVelocity: Velocity is improving. Project ahead of schedule.
insights.highQualityRisk: High quality risk. Bug count is increasing.
insights.improvingQuality: Quality is improving. Bug count is decreasing.
